titleStmt.title: The safegard of the soule Declaring sundry soueraigne salues tending to the comfort and saluation of the same: very necessarie to bee learned and obserued of all men, and at all times, but chiefely in the extremitie of sicknes, and grieuous pangs of death. Composed by Lawrence Bankes, preacher of the word of God: and parson of Staunton, in the county of Glocester.
titleStmt.author: Bankes, Lawrence.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by G. P[urslowe] for Iohn Clarke, and are to bee sold vnder S. Peters Church in Cornhill,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
